If you haven't heard about this game already I'd like to welcome you out from under your rock and tell you to buy this game. It's a puzzle game with some platforming elements to it, extremely witty dialogue and a certainly unique way of dealing with puzzles.

The central mechanic of the game is that you've got a gun that shoots portals, which enables you to reach different areas in each puzzle, and you can only have one, two way portal open at once, which is obviously the challenge.

Overall it's extremely well executed. It's a short game, and it doesn't overstay it's welcome.
This game... Is such a mind-blowing experience! ^.^ Literally puzzles galore! Recommend for the gamers who love problem solving and puzzles. Good story as well as gameplay.
Sehr guter Puzzle shooter mit eine mänge an rätseln und gute grafik ^^

The game that started a phenomena and gave Black Mesa a rival, is a strange and mind-warping tale. An Aperture Science test subject awakens from stasis to start a "normal" day of routine experimenting only to find herself struggling for her life against a sentient power-mad super-computer named; GLaDOS. If you've ever read or seen Arthur C. Clarke's "2001: A Space Odyssey", you already know just how menacing a cold calculating eye in the sky can be. Featuring an a awesome soundtrack, and a Challenge Mode to try once you've finished the main game, this one will leave you begging for more. Luckily, Portal is like an introduction to Portal 2's longer, more intricate story. If you're looking for some good physics-based fun, then you've just struck gold.
Just 2 words: 'Mind Blowing'
Vraiment très bon

I don't think I could really find anything I don't like about this. Maybe the fact that it only takes a few hours to finish the main gameplay but in this case it's an advantage, because it fits the narrative and it makes it a game everyone should have time to play. It's one of the most inventive games I've played, and what I'm sure will be one of the most memorable classic games in the future. Even if you don't enjoy games involving puzzle, I think you'd be able to make an exception for this game. Also, you're missing tons of references by not playing this game. 

Look at you still reading this review when there's game to play. What are you doing? Buy this game if you haven't, and start playing it!

lo que me gustó fueron los comentarios de glados, los cuales son ingeniosos y extravagantes je. el juego es algocorto ya que se termina en 4 horas a lo sumo y no tiene muchos logros. la historia es simple a primera vista pero si se analiza el trasfondo se vuelve inquietante y perturbadora, aunque el final no es tan intenso como esperaba. luego de terminar la historia se pueden jugar los desafios y escenarios extra los cuales pasarlos en nivel oro cuesta bastante. recomiendo portal 1 y 2 debido a su bajo precio y la mecanica tremendamente ingeniosa que no se encuentra en otros juegos.
Just make sure you play it before you play Portal 2. It ruins the feel to play this, and then play Portal 2.

Un jeu redoutable de simplicité et d’inventivité, purement et simplement bluffant. D'un postulat de départ simple -la possibilité de créer deux portails interconnectés- les petits gars de Valve surprennent. 
Le gros point fort de Portal c'est avant tout son univers: préparez-vous à être titillé à chaque instant par l'IA du complexe, représentée par une voix robotique insidieuse, GLaDOS, qui tour à tour vous fera rire mais également peur, vous suivra chaque instant en vous gratifiant de remarques très à propos. Au delà de ça les tableaux sont réussis, plutôt retors sur la fin mais ne présentant jamais une difficulté insurmontable. Là où le bas blesse c'est la durée de vie du soft: 3h. 
Mais au prix où il est vendu, autant se faire plaisir et ne pas passer à côté de ce bijou...

[h1]A Great Puzzle Game[/h1]
This game brings in the concept of using teleportation to solve puzzles. It is a great game that plays smoothly and the commentary is humorous to listen to. Although the game is short with only 19 levels, there is the ability to download maps made by other users to extend the playtime. Also, have a look at Portal 2, the sequel to this game, if you want to play more of this great game!

When you go through a portal up is down and down is up but up is also right or left. Down may also be left or right although sometimes left is right or right is up. Also left will be left unless it's not. Now your thinking with portals.
Honestly one of the best games I have ever played

Короткая(

[u][b]-Quick Review-[/b][/u]
Portal is a First-Person Puzzle game developed by Valve and released late 2007. Portal is completely dedicated to solving problems by using two portals to move objects or the protagonist through the various puzzles.


[u][b]-Detailed breakdown review-[/b][/u]
[b]Story:[/b] Portal takes place exclusively in the Apature Science Laboratories Enrichment Center. The Silent Protagonist [i]Bby the name of “Chell”)[/i] awakens in a small room, she is instructed by the Artificial Intelligence known as “GlaDOS” to complete the various test chambers and then Chell will be rewarded with cake.
http://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=517834046

[b]Gameplay:[/b] The gameplay introduced by Portal was probably one of the most innovative and unique concepts introduced by valve, and easily one of the best games released in 2007.
As you progress through the game, you are introduced slowly to new concepts and new tricks that you can implement. You start the game with the extremely primitive concept of “put the block on the button”, but after completing a sequence of Test Chambers and obtaining the “Aperture Science Handheld Portal Device” or just “portal gun”, the puzzles get really crazy.

[b]Achievements:[/b] There are 15 achievements in Portal, five achievements are normally unlocked on your first play through, another five achievements are very well explained and relatively easy to obtain [i](Generally by knowing the best location to get them, or preforming specific tricks, or completing some advanced maps)[/i].
The last set of achievements is the toughest, earning gold medals on all portal challenges, Detaching all security cameras from the walls, and Finding all the hidden Transmissions. [i](Unless you're going to put an ungodly amount of time into portal, you'll probably need to read guides.)[/i]
http://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=517834071

[b]Price:[/b] Portal is priced at $9.99, the value system I use is “Price divided by GameTime = Value”. Generally playing through the Portal story once will be about 6 hours, give or take a few hours depending on puzzle solving skill. This game has enough content to keep the player busy for 9 hours, but most people won't take advantage of all the features, so the price is a bit high. I suggest going for a bundle deal like the Orange Box [i](Especially if you're interested in the Half-Life 2 games)[/i], or waiting for a steam sale before purchasing.

[b]Conclusion:[/b] Story: Excellent, some of the finest content Valve has ever released. Gameplay: Memorable, enjoyable, and addicting. Achievements: a nice blend of difficulty, but not an easy 100% completion game. Price: A bit higher then what I'd prefer, but on the enjoyable factor, Portal is definitely worth it.
I have a personal bias for this game, because the first product I bought on Steam was the Orange Box, so this is among the first games I've ever played on Steam! I easily recommend this game to anyone who enjoys puzzle games, but this game can appeal to just about anyone, hardcore and softcore alike.
http://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=517834102

------Edits and updates------
Edit/Update September 13, 2015:
Here's the URL to see my review for [url=http://steamcommunity.com/id/atratzu/recommended/620] Portal 2[/url]

Portal c'est quoi ? Portal est un jeu à la première personne dans lequel vous devrez résoudre une multitude d'énigme à l'aide du Portal Gun, mais ce n'est pas pour autemps un fps (First Person SHOUTER) car vous n'aurez par à proprement parler d'ennemie mis à part les tourrelles automatique. Si vous êtes fan d'énigme ce jeu est pour vous car il peut-être parfois cruellement facile comme cruellement complexe ! Si vous êtes du genre à foncer sans regarder autour de vous et sans annaliser correctement le niveau vous risquerez de vous griller les neurones alors que la réponse est au dessu de votre tête ! Ce jeu est aussi complexe du côté où il prend en compte la gravité et l'accélation l'ors d'une chute. Mais attention car comme expliquer plus haut vous possèdez le Portal Gun (ou générateur de portail) qui vous permettera de créer donc des portails certe mais qui sera votre seul moyen pour résoudre les énigmes !! Portal à beau être sorti en 2007 il possède de beaux graphisme et quelque possibilité unique en son genre comme la gravité particulièrement réelle ou encore la logique des portails qui prennent en compte votre vitesse ET votre sens de gravité ! Donc je vous recommande FORTEMENT ce jeu pour toutes se possibiltées, de plus que le prix du jeu très abordable et qu'il ne demande pas la meilleurs carte graphique du monde (même un pc lent peut le faire fonctionner)

A fun and challenging game. You are a test subject for Aperture Science Laboratories, and you get to try out the Aperture Science Handheld Portal Device, a device which- oh who cares everyone already knows. You get a portal gun and complete tests for some scientists.
The tests are challenging at times and the atmosphere can be genuinely creepy at times.
9/10 Strongly recommended.

Pure fun. Solving spatial puzzles while listening to an amusingly sarcastic AI. What more could a gamer ask for? It's not a very long game, sure -- but it's very enjoyable from the beginning until the end.

Also a good test for how good someone's gaming taste is: if someone claims Portal 2 to be better than the original, you can safely disregard all of their opinions.

Hello, and again, welcome to the Aperture Science Computer Aided Enrichment Center.

You are Chell. You remember a tiny bit of signing up for some random test program, but that memory begins to fade away. You will need to go through 19 test chambers by yourself. Good luck!


I'm supposed to tell you how good this test program is, but I'm not allowed to due to test protocol.

Get the demo. Like it? Buy it.

The game only works because it is so short. Even is such a small dose -- I finished the campaign in some 2 hours -- solving the puzzles starts feeling like a chore really fast. The writing is good, and wanting to see how the story would unfold was really the really the only reason I kept playing. Pick it up if it's on sale.
